This is a stock challenge in which you build a shuttle which can do a bunch of things while trying to make it as light as possible.

It is inspired by 700NitroXpress's Versatility Marathon Challenge but with different, and hopefully simpler rules.

The goal is to create a single stage shuttle which can deliver a 4 ton approx 2mx2m payload to the surface of any of the following destinations, and return to kerbin

Mun, Minmus, Duna, Gilly, Laythe, Bop, or Vall.

The suggested payload is a hitchhiker can, or anything else that's close to 4 tons. It must be gently set down on the surface.

The shuttle must return to Kerbin and soft-land. It doesn't have to look like the space shuttle and you are not restricted to vertical or horizontal take-off or landing. Do it however you like.

That's it! try to demonstrate that you can deliver the payload to one of the planets of your choosing, (or all of them if you have the time).

You may refuel the craft using orbital or surface fuel stations. You are encouraged to re-use the craft.

Don't be pedantic.
